intro: Euchresta longiracemosa, commonly known as the long-branch milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the United States. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and showy, clustered flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that is toxic to many animals, including livestock. Its flowers are typically pale yellow to orange in color and attract various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Euchresta longiracemosa thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and along streambanks.
